page.title: 05Clubs and Activities
page.content: Iwade and Kemsley have most of the clubs and activities - people from Milton and Bobbing seem to use Sittingbourne amenities. Iwade is fortunate in having two halls. Scouts Cubs, Brownies and a church based Lamplighters groups meet in the school hall. While a Youth club (which disbands and reforms as leaders appear or have had enough), Womens institute, Evergreen club, Keep Fit, Playgroup and Toddlers clubs meet in the village hall. Kemsley have a Youth club, a Majorettes Troop, Playgroup and Cubs which meet in their hall. While a Keep Fit group meet at Bobbing village hall Clubs connected with Milton church meet at a hall in the centre of Milton clearly the existance of clubs depend on suitable meeting places being available and dedicated people to organise and run them.
